page.title: 06A FARMER'S DAY
page.content:
The farmer's day starts around 6.30 when his first job is to milk the cows. Then he visits the sheep and bullocks to ensure they are all right, before breakfast at 8.00. Shortly after 8.30 he prepares the tractors, mower, baler and other machinery needed for hay harvest, which takes him until lunchtime at 1.00. An hour later he rounds up the sheep for shearing, and also selects some lambs for the Fatstock Market at Exeter on Monday. Store Market is on Friday. After half an hour for tea at 6.00 he decides to start cutting a field of grass for hay. Around 9.00 he tackles the updating of the Farm Accounts before watching the television news at 10.00 and finally going to bed.
Mrs June Butt (Farmer's Wife)
